alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Stokes; Surry; Watauga; Wilkes; Yadkin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:04PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Alleghany and Surry Counties in northwestern North Carolina, northwestern Stokes County in north central North Carolina, Wilkes, southeastern Watauga and northwestern Yadkin Counties in northwestern North Carolina, south central Floyd and southeastern Carroll Counties in southwestern Virginia, west central Henry County in south central Virginia and Patrick Counties in southwestern Virginia through 830 PM EDT... At 804 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mabry Mill to near Mountain Park to near Blowing Rock In Caldwell County. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boone... Mount Airy... North Wilkesboro... Elkin... Wilkesboro... Fairview... and Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
